page.title: 16Bilston Carnival
page.content: Bilston Carnival is held every year on the last Saturday in June. Local organistions,cubs,brownies etc. each decorate a float. Meetings are held weeks before to decide how each float will be decorated. On the morning of the big day all the floats assemble in Hckman Park to be judged. The winner receives a trophy & 15 pounds,there are 2nd & 3rd prizes too. After judging a local band leads a procession through the streets of Bilston. The floats and other bands follow. People line the streets and throw money to the floats they like. The money goes to charity. At the end the floats return to the park and prizes are awarded. The drivers of the floats are paid for their time in thanks. There is a Fair afterwards.
